   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Tests of traffic between seven Diameter nodes in four realms,
   23: %% connected as follows.
   24: %%
   25: %%                  ----- SERVER1.REALM2 -----
   26: %%                /                            \
   27: %%               /  ----- SERVER2.REALM2 -----  \
   28: %%              | /                            \ |
   29: %%   CLIENT.REALM1 ------ SERVER3.REALM2 ------ CLIENT.REALM4
   30: %%              | \                            / |
   31: %%              |  \                          /  |
   32: %%               \   ---- SERVER1.REALM3 -----  /
   33: %%                \                            /
   34: %%                  ----- SERVER2.REALM3 -----
   35: %%
   36: 
   37: -module(diameter_failover_SUITE).
   38: 
   39: %% testcases, no common_test dependency
   40: -export([run/0]).
   41: 
   42: %% common_test wrapping
   43: -export([suite/0,
   44:          all/0,
   45:          parallel/1]).
   46: 
   47: %% internal
   48: -export([send_ok/0,
   49:          send_nok/0,
   50:          send_discard_1/0,
   51:          send_discard_2/0]).
   52: 
   53: %% diameter callbacks
   54: -export([pick_peer/4,
   55:          prepare_request/3,
   56:          prepare_retransmit/3,
   57:          handle_error/4,
   58:          handle_answer/4,
   59:          handle_request/3]).
   60: 
   61: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
   62: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter_gen_base_rfc3588.hrl").
   63: 
   64: %% ===========================================================================
   65: 
   66: -define(util, diameter_util).
   67: 
   68: -define(ADDR, {127,0,0,1}).
   69: 
   70: -define(CLIENT1, "CLIENT.REALM1").
   71: -define(CLIENT2, "CLIENT.REALM4").
   72: -define(SERVER1, "SERVER1.REALM2").
   73: -define(SERVER2, "SERVER2.REALM2").
   74: -define(SERVER3, "SERVER3.REALM2").
   75: -define(SERVER4, "SERVER1.REALM3").
   76: -define(SERVER5, "SERVER2.REALM3").
   77: 
   78: -define(IS_CLIENT(Svc), Svc == ?CLIENT1; Svc == ?CLIENT2).
   79: 
   80: -define(CLIENTS, [?CLIENT1, ?CLIENT2]).
   81: -define(SERVERS, [?SERVER1, ?SERVER2, ?SERVER3, ?SERVER4, ?SERVER5]).
   82: 
   83: -define(DICT_COMMON,  ?DIAMETER_DICT_COMMON).
   84: 
   85: -define(APP_ALIAS, the_app).
   86: -define(APP_ID, ?DICT_COMMON:id()).
   87: 
   88: %% Config for diameter:start_service/2.
   89: -define(SERVICE(Host),
   90:         [{'Origin-Host', Host},
   91:          {'Origin-Realm', realm(Host)},
   92:          {'Host-IP-Address', [?ADDR]},
   93:          {'Vendor-Id', 12345},
   94:          {'Product-Name', "OTP/diameter"},
   95:          {'Acct-Application-Id', [?APP_ID]},
   96:          {application, [{alias, ?APP_ALIAS},
   97:                         {dictionary, ?DICT_COMMON},
   98:                         {module, #diameter_callback
   99:                                   {peer_up = false,
  100:                                    peer_down = false,
  101:                                    default = ?MODULE}},
  102:                         {answer_errors, callback}]}]).
  103: 
  104: -define(SUCCESS, 2001).
  105: 
  106: %% Value of Termination-Cause determines client/server behaviour.
  107: -define(LOGOUT,   ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_LOGOUT').
  108: -define(MOVED,    ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_USER_MOVED').
  109: -define(TIMEOUT,  ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_SESSION_TIMEOUT').
  110: 
  111: %% ===========================================================================
  112: 
  113: suite() ->
  114:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 90}}].
  115: 
  116: all() ->
  117:     [parallel].
  118: 
  119: parallel(_Config) ->
  120:     run().
  121: 
  122: %% ===========================================================================
  123: 
  124: %% run/0
  125: 
  126: run() ->
  127:     ok = diameter:start(),
  128:     try
  129:         ?util:run([{fun traffic/0, 60000}])
  130:     after
  131:         ok = diameter:stop()
  132:     end.
  133: 
  134: %% traffic/0
  135: 
  136: traffic() ->
  137:     Servers = start_services(),
  138:     ok = connect(Servers),
  139:     [] = send(),
  140:     [] = stop_services(),
  141:     [] = ets:tab2list(diameter_request).
  142: 
  143: %% start_services/0
  144: 
  145: start_services() ->
  146:     Servers = [server(N) || N <- ?SERVERS],
  147:     [] = [T || C <- ?CLIENTS,
  148:                T <- [diameter:start_service(C, ?SERVICE(C))],
  149:                T /= ok],
  150:     Servers.
  151: 
  152: %% send/0
  153: 
  154: send() ->
  155:     Funs = [send_ok, send_nok, send_discard_1, send_discard_2],
  156:     ?util:run([[{?MODULE, F, []} || F <- Funs]]).
  157: 
  158: %% connect/1
  159: 
  160: connect(Servers) ->
  161:     lists:foreach(fun(C) -> connect(C, Servers) end, ?CLIENTS).
  162: 
  163: %% stop_services/0
  164: 
  165: stop_services() ->
  166:     [{H,T} || H <- ?CLIENTS ++ ?SERVERS,
  167:               T <- [diameter:stop_service(H)],
  168:               T /= ok].
  169: 
  170: %% ----------------------------------------
  171: 
  172: server(Name) ->
  173:     ok = diameter:start_service(Name, ?SERVICE(Name)),
  174:     {Name, ?util:listen(Name, tcp)}.
  175: 
  176: connect(Name, Refs) ->
  177:     [{{Name, ?util:connect(Name, tcp, LRef)}, T} || {_, LRef} = T <- Refs].
  178: 
  179: %% ===========================================================================
  180: %% traffic testcases
  181: 
  182: %% Send an STR and expect success after SERVER3 answers after a couple
  183: %% of failovers.
  184: send_ok() ->
  185:     Req = #diameter_base_STR{'Destination-Realm' = realm(?SERVER1),
  186:                              'Termination-Cause' = ?LOGOUT,
  187:                              'Auth-Application-Id' = ?APP_ID},
  188:     #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS,
  189:                        'Origin-Host' = ?SERVER3}
  190:         = call(?CLIENT1, Req).
  191: 
  192: %% Send an STR and expect failure when both servers fail.
  193: send_nok() ->
  194:     Req = #diameter_base_STR{'Destination-Realm' = realm(?SERVER4),
  195:                              'Termination-Cause' = ?LOGOUT,
  196:                              'Auth-Application-Id' = ?APP_ID},
  197:     {failover, ?LOGOUT} = call(?CLIENT1, Req).
  198: 
  199: %% Send an STR and have prepare_retransmit discard it.
  200: send_discard_1() ->
  201:     Req = #diameter_base_STR{'Destination-Realm' = realm(?SERVER1),
  202:                              'Termination-Cause' = ?TIMEOUT,
  203:                              'Auth-Application-Id' = ?APP_ID},
  204:     {rejected, ?TIMEOUT} = call(?CLIENT2, Req).
  205: send_discard_2() ->
  206:     Req = #diameter_base_STR{'Destination-Realm' = realm(?SERVER4),
  207:                              'Termination-Cause' = ?MOVED,
  208:                              'Auth-Application-Id' = ?APP_ID},
  209:     {discarded, ?MOVED} = call(?CLIENT2, Req).
  210: 
  211: %% ===========================================================================
  212: 
  213: realm(Host) ->
  214:     tl(lists:dropwhile(fun(C) -> C /= $. end, Host)).
  215: 
  216: call(Svc, Req) ->
  217:     diameter:call(Svc, ?APP_ALIAS, Req, [{filter, realm}]).
  218: 
  219: %% ===========================================================================
  220: %% diameter callbacks
  221: 
  222: %% pick_peer/4
  223: 
  224: %% Choose a server other than SERVER3 or SERVER5 if possible.
  225: pick_peer(Peers, _, Svc, _State)
  226:   when ?IS_CLIENT(Svc) ->
  227:     case lists:partition(fun({_, #diameter_caps{origin_host = {_, OH}}}) ->
  228:                                  OH /= ?SERVER3 andalso OH /= ?SERVER5
  229:                          end,
  230:                          Peers)
  231:     of
  232:         {[], [Peer]} ->
  233:             {ok, Peer};
  234:         {[Peer | _], _} ->
  235:             {ok, Peer}
  236:     end.
  237: 
  238: %% prepare_request/3
  239: 
  240: prepare_request(Pkt, Svc, {_Ref, Caps})
  241:   when ?IS_CLIENT(Svc) ->
  242:     {send, prepare(Pkt, Caps)}.
  243: 
  244: prepare(#diameter_packet{msg = Req}, Caps) ->
  245:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
  246:                    origin_realm = {OR, _}}
  247:         = Caps,
  248:     Req#diameter_base_STR{'Origin-Host' = OH,
  249:                           'Origin-Realm' = OR,
  250:                           'Session-Id' = diameter:session_id(OH)}.
  251: 
  252: %% prepare_retransmit/3
  253: 
  254: prepare_retransmit(#diameter_packet{header = H} = P, Svc, {_,_})
  255:   when ?IS_CLIENT(Svc) ->
  256:     #diameter_header{is_retransmitted = true} = H,  %% assert
  257:     prepare(P).
  258: 
  259: prepare(#diameter_packet{msg = M} = P) ->
  260:     case M#diameter_base_STR.'Termination-Cause' of
  261:         ?LOGOUT  -> {send, P};
  262:         ?MOVED   -> discard;
  263:         ?TIMEOUT -> {discard, rejected}
  264:     end.
  265: 
  266: %% handle_error/4
  267: 
  268: handle_error(Reason, Req, _, _) ->
  269:     {Reason, Req#diameter_base_STR.'Termination-Cause'}.
  270: 
  271: %% handle_answer/4
  272: 
  273: handle_answer(Pkt, _Req, Svc, _Peer)
  274:   when ?IS_CLIENT(Svc) ->
  275:     #diameter_packet{msg = Rec, errors = []} = Pkt,
  276:     Rec.
  277: 
  278: %% handle_request/3
  279: 
  280: %% Only SERVER3 actually answers.
  281: handle_request(Pkt, ?SERVER3, {_, Caps}) ->
  282:     #diameter_packet{header = #diameter_header{is_retransmitted = true},
  283:                      msg = #diameter_base_STR{'Session-Id' = SId}}
  284:         = Pkt,
  285:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
  286:                    origin_realm = {OR, _}}
  287:         = Caps,
  288: 
  289:     {reply, #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS,
  290:                                'Session-Id' = SId,
  291:                                'Origin-Host' = OH,
  292:                                'Origin-Realm' = OR}};
  293: 
  294: %% Others kill the transport to force failover.
  295: handle_request(_, _, {TPid, _}) ->
  296:     exit(TPid, kill),
  297:     discard.
